description.en: Helvetica Standard is a random comical short that is self-contained, and generally outside the main story of [Nichijou](https://mangadex.com/manga/188), being a full-color follow-up to the hit manga series. Funny and heartwarming, this two-part series is a humorous look at modern day Japanese design in comic form and a deep-dive into the artistic and creative mind of Arawi Keiichi. Part comic, part diary, part art and design book, Helvetica Standard is a deconstruction of the world of nichijou.

biography.en:
Keiichi Arawi is a manga artist born on December 29, 1977, in Gunma Prefecture. In 2006, he made his debut with Kazemachi published in Monthly Comic Flapper. Later that year, he launched Nichijou in Monthly Shōnen Ace. Nichijou is currently ranked in the top 50 best selling manga in Japan.

His manga are known for minimalist, absurdist humor that expresses the insanity or inanity of everyday life and human relationships. In 2020, Arawi started posting animated shorts on his YouTube channel, in which he preforms all the voice acting.
